titles.title: Bringing Awareness and Knowledge to Exempt Schools Against Legislative Encroachment Act
To prohibit certain nutrition rules with respect to foods sold at schools as a fundraiser.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education.

committee.subcommittee: Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education
committee.name: House Education and the Workforce

bill.summary: 9/9/2014--Introduced. Bringing Awareness and Knowledge to Exempt Schools Against Legislative Encroachment Act - Prohibits the Secretary of Agriculture from applying the rule entitled "National School Lunch Program and School Breakfast Program: Nutrition Standards for All Foods Sold in School as Required by the Healthy, Hunger-Free Kids Act of 2010" to food sold as a fundraiser that takes place on the grounds of a school. (The rule requires the Secretary to set nutrition standards for all foods sold in schools that are not foods sold under the school lunch and breakfast programs.)
